wikipedia_page.main: Alan Pennington (4 April 1916 – 2 June 1961) was a British sprinter. He competed in the men's 100 metres at the 1936 Summer Olympics.He served in World War II reaching the rank of Captain. He committed suicide in a hotel room in Lisbon.
